What other trouble did you have getting make to be your external builder?
Was this an upgrade from an older Eclipse build?
Were you enabling and disabling the Java builder?

nope, it is not a java project
i created external builders for a non java project (to build java 1.5 code with
make).

i had no problem getting it to work. i have the working dir for the builder 
set to be the project (it's some variable) - then when i renamed the project the
builders became 'Invalid'. ok, i thought, i will edit them and fix that. but no,
'edit' was disabled. OK, i though, i will delete the buggers and recreate them.
but no, i could not delete them. i looked in the log and i found the stacktrace.
i ended up having to _delete_ the whole project and re-featching it from cvs. i
was lucky i did not lose any real work.

is this an upgrade? possibly - i was playing around with different builds today.
all crash real bad except m5-motif and m7-gtk. i stuck with the latter for now.

cheers
I'm able to reproduce the problem easily. We don't handle project renames.

The project renaming issue comes down to bug 37944, which I've grabbed and will 
try to address for M8.

The bug here is that we create a special kind of object (ErrorConfig) for 
configs that we can't instantiate. The performOk code totally doesn't handle 
ErrorConfigs. Glaring hole. Should be easy to fix.

Fixed the problem with ErrorConfigs in BuilderPropertyPage. We now store the 
ICommand in the ErrorConfig when it's created and then extract that command in 
performOk. Please verify, DarinS.
*** Bug 51889 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
